title: Mountains to Sea
subText: Journey through New Zealand's diverse environments, from windy alpine peaks to gloomy seabeds.

paragraph.title: NULL
paragraph.text: Over 2,500 native plants and animals make up the displays. How many molluscs can you count? Can you find the ship rat eating a wētā? Climb to the bush canopy to get a kererū’s perspective and marvel at our gigantic skeleton of a 21-metre pygmy blue whale.

paragraph.title: Brought to life
paragraph.text: Listen to kea laugh as they rip into a backpack and hear the crashing waves of the sea as a shag spreads its wings to dry. Through sound, lighting, and design each ecosystem comes alive.

paragraph.title: X-ray room
paragraph.text: Peek inside whales, dolphins and seals – can you tell each skeleton apart? Our X-ray room reveals a glimpse into Te Papa’s marine mammals collection.
